task.summary: Default task
Updated all class files to match original project
Reworking the command system to be more simple.
Reworking the command system to be more simple.
Command system has been simplified and the interface has extended to include location name and basic player info.
Player can now take items that are in the same room as them. Also, added a todo list.
Consumable items can now be eaten/drunk and will heal the player.
Consumable items can now be eaten/drunk and will heal the player.
The command system has been rewritten to integrate the commandParser, allowing for more flexible inputs.

Moved all of the functions that effect other objects from CommandHandler to GameSystems. Created Container class and am integrating it into the game, so that they can be unlocked if the player has the correct key in their inventory. Then, when looking at the container it should display its contents and allow the player to take them.

Containers can now be opened and closed, allowing the player to take items from them. The items are properly detected as being visible/invisible to the player based on the state of the container. Still need to add key items to allow locking and unlocking containers and doors.

Reworked the display format to make it more readable and easier to follow. The room description and its contents is now displayed as a header, with commands and their results showing underneath it as interactions. The interactions are cleared upon moving to a new room.

Going to perform a fairly major rework to the way the engine builds the world and accesses information. Most notably, moving to an ID system and storing the default objects in one list for reference while keeping a seperate list of objects that actually exist within the game world. This will allow multiples of the same object, such as consumables, while allowing the engine to keep track of where they are in the game world.

Working on moving everything over to the new ContentSlot system to better keep track of the contents in an inventory, whether for a room, container, or the player's. They ensure that objects of the same name are stackable while keeping track of quantity and the IDs of all objects in that stack. This will better facilitate saving/loading the data for where objects are, and for the contents of containers and rooms.

To accommodate the new ContentSlot system, I also had to rework the command structure, so that now a Command object contains the command and references to any relevant objects. The character creation has also been moved to its own class and refactored to be easily expandable for future changes.
Still todo: refactor actions involving items with the new ContentSlot system.
Redesigning the way the engine tracks entities, instead keeping them all in one structure and retrieving them by key.
Entities are now properly tracked by key(ID:INSTANCE). Now reworking commands to work with the new Entity system.
DataHandler now can save and load data for the game
DataHandler now can save and load data for the game
DataHandler now can save and load data for the game
DataHandler now can save and load data for the game

MESSAGE.value: Updated all class files to match original project
Reworking the command system to be more simple.
Command system has been simplified and the interface has extended to include location name and basic player info.
Player can now take items that are in the same room as them. Also, added a todo list.
Consumable items can now be eaten/drunk and will heal the player.
The command system has been rewritten to integrate the commandParser, allowing for more flexible inputs.

Moved all of the functions that effect other objects from CommandHandler to GameSystems. Created Container class and am integrating it into the game, so that they can be unlocked if the player has the correct key in their inventory. Then, when looking at the container it should display its contents and allow the player to take them.

Containers can now be opened and closed, allowing the player to take items from them. The items are properly detected as being visible/invisible to the player based on the state of the container. Still need to add key items to allow locking and unlocking containers and doors.

Reworked the display format to make it more readable and easier to follow. The room description and its contents is now displayed as a header, with commands and their results showing underneath it as interactions. The interactions are cleared upon moving to a new room.

Going to perform a fairly major rework to the way the engine builds the world and accesses information. Most notably, moving to an ID system and storing the default objects in one list for reference while keeping a seperate list of objects that actually exist within the game world. This will allow multiples of the same object, such as consumables, while allowing the engine to keep track of where they are in the game world.

Working on moving everything over to the new ContentSlot system to better keep track of the contents in an inventory, whether for a room, container, or the player's. They ensure that objects of the same name are stackable while keeping track of quantity and the IDs of all objects in that stack. This will better facilitate saving/loading the data for where objects are, and for the contents of containers and rooms.

To accommodate the new ContentSlot system, I also had to rework the command structure, so that now a Command object contains the command and references to any relevant objects. The character creation has also been moved to its own class and refactored to be easily expandable for future changes.
Still todo: refactor actions involving items with the new ContentSlot system.
Redesigning the way the engine tracks entities, instead keeping them all in one structure and retrieving them by key.
Entities are now properly tracked by key(ID:INSTANCE). Now reworking commands to work with the new Entity system.
DataHandler now can save and load data for the game
